question: Who was the first Christian emperor of Rome?
explanation1: Wrong, Augustus was the first emperor of Rome but not a Christian.
explanation2: Wrong, Julius Caesar was not a Christian nor an emperor in the period when Christianity was established as an official religion of the Roman Empire.
explanation3: Wrong, Nero is famous for persecuting Christians and not an advocate for Christianity.
explanation4: Correct, Emperor Constantine was the first emperor to convert to Christianity and established it as an official religion of the Roman Empire in 313AD via the Edict of Milan.

question: In what year did Martin Luther post the Ninety-Five Theses on the door of the Castle Church in Wittenberg?
explanation1: Correct! Martin Luther posted the Ninety-Five Theses on the door of the Castle Church in Wittenberg on October 31, 1517.
explanation2: Wrong. This is not the correct year. Martin Luther posted the Ninety-Five Theses on the door of the Castle Church in Wittenberg on October 31, 1517.
